content:
• Thursday, December 27, 2018
  • APHA

    APHA, OPK, ESV and OSUR among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: APHA +20.3%. CZWI +8.4%.OPK +7.9%. SMTA +5.9%. LEVL +5.5%.
    • Top Losers: EVH -9.7%. OSUR -9%. APEN -7.4%. ARQL -6%. ESV -5.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 28 Comments
  • OPK

    Opko Health, CEO agree to settle SEC probe; shares jump 15%

    • Opko Health (NYSEMKT:OPK) jumps 15% in after-hours trading after the company and its chairman and CEO Phillip Frost agree to settle certain Securities and Exchange Commission allegations that they violated securities laws.
    • Frost agrees to pay $5.5M and is prohibited, with certain exceptions, from trading in penny stocks under the settlement.
    • Frost will continue as Opko's CEO and chairman.
    • Opko agrees to pay a $100,000 penalty and to take certain actions related to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
    • Frost and Opko neither admit to nor deny the SEC's allegations.
    • Previously: Trading halt on OPKO Health to continue until lawsuit-related information submitted (Sept. 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 53 Comments
  • TGNA

    Tegna offers some Premion `Premium Audience Selects' refunds

    • Tegna (TGNA -5.4%) is offering full refunds for "Premium Audience Selects" 2018 campaigns affected by "system issues" that ended on or before Nov. 30, 2018.
    • The company identified system issues that affected certain targeting segments and found that they had not been delivered correctly.
    • The issue's effect on 2018 results are immaterial, Tegna says, although it affects up to 17% of Premion's total revenue for the year.
    • Issue has been resolved and Premion has implemented new ad operations processes as a result.
    • Previously: TEGNA beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Nov. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • ANY

    VJET, SGLB, & ANY among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +40%. voxeljet AG (NYSE:VJET) +20%. Quantum Corporation (NYSE:QTM-OLD) +11%. Sigma Labs (NASDAQ:SGLB) +10%. Luna Innovations (NASDAQ:LUNA) +9%.
    • Losers: Safe-T Group (NASDAQ:SFET) -18%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) -16%. USA Technologies (NASDAQ:USAT) -11%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) -11%. Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 5 Comments

  • Selling picks up steam - Nasdaq down 3%

    • A bit less than 90 minutes before the close, the averages have given back well more than half of yesterday's historic bounce.
    • The Nasdaq is down 3% and the Dow and S&P 500 off about 2.5%.
    • Today's selling is as broad-based as yesterday's buying was. A quick glance at this S&P 500 heatmap shows not one name in the green.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is lower by eight basis points to 2.73%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 8 Comments
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm attempts to reassure investors

    • Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP) has been badly leaking oil since mid-year, with yesterday's sharp decline looking particularly ugly given the melt-up in the broader market.
    • "We want to assure the market that our business fundamentals are unchanged," says CEO Laurence Cooper. The management team takes note of the restructured relationship with Intrexon, the clean-up of the balance sheet, and partnerships with Regeneron and Eden BioCell.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares are up 3.1% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 11 Comments
  • DWSN

    Dawson Geophysical and Gevo among Energy/Materials gainers; Camber Energy and Centrus Energy among losers

    • Gainers: Dawson Geophysical (NASDAQ:DWSN) +10%. Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +9%. PQ Group (NYSE:PQG) +7%. Westlake Chemical Partners (NYSE:WLKP) +6%. VOC Energy Trust (NYSE:VOC) +6%.
    • Losers: Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) -27%. Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) -18%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) -17%. Crescent Point Energy (NYSE:CPG) -12%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • BLK

    Asset manager stocks retreat as bull market loses steam

    • Asset managers, specifically those big in the exchange-traded funds business, benefited from the longest bull market in history as investors piled cash into index-tracking funds to buy the market.
    • But that stopped this year. The S&P 500 Asset Management & Custody Banks sub-industry index has declined 29% in the past year.
    • BlackRock (BLK -1.6%), the world's biggest money manager, is down 27% over the same time period and Invesco took an even bigger hit, down 56%.
    • Flows into ETFs have fallen 34%, according to data from Bloomberg Intelligence.
    • ETF traders, though, have profited as turnover exceeded $24.8T in 2018, Bloomberg reports. Virtu Financial (VIRT +2.3%), one of the largest lead market makers for U.S. ETFs, climbed 39% in the past year.
    • Previously: Morningstar: November U.S. mutual fund, ETF outflows stabilize (Dec. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • NURO

    NeuroMetrix +23% on patent approval

    • NeuroMetrix (NASDAQ:NURO) announces the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued a patent for "novel methods of monitoring electrode-skin contact for safe delivery of electrical stimulation while the user is sleeping."
    • The patent becomes the tenth U.S. utility patent covering the company's Quell Wearable Pain Relief Technology.
    • NURO shares are up 22.8% to $0.86.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • BCRH

    Blue Capital Reinsurance leads financials gainers; Dunxin Financial and Condor Hospitality among losers

    • Gainers: Blue Capital Reinsurance Holdings (NYSE:BCRH) +15%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) +9%. GWG Holdings (NASDAQ:GWGH) +8%. Siebert Financial (NASDAQ:SIEB) +8%. LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) +7%.
    • Losers: Dunxin Financial Holdings (NYSEMKT:DXF) -24%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -14%. Condor Hospitality Trust (NYSEMKT:CDOR) -11%. Marine Petroleum Trust (NASDAQ:MARPS) -7%. Curo Group Holdings (NYSE:CURO) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM

    Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Energous Corporation (NASDAQ:WATT) +95%. BioXcel Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BTAI) +81%. CounterPath (NASDAQ:CPAH) +25%. Novus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NVUS) +21%. LiveXLive Media (NASDAQ:LIVX) +19%. Netshoes (NYSE:NETS) +17%. Avadel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVDL) +17%. China Online Education Group (NYSE:COE) +16%. Meili (NYSE:MOGU) +16%. Blue Capital Reinsurance Holdings (NYSE:BCRH) +14%.

Live Ventures (NASDAQ:LIVE) -17%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) -15%. Centrus Energy (NYSEMKT:LEU) -15%. Safe-T Group (NASDAQ:SFET) -15%. Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) -14%. Lilis Energy (NYSEMKT:LLEX) -14%.

  • KTCC

    Key Tronic to establish new manufacturing facility in Vietnam

    • Key Tronic (KTCC -5.1%) has signed a letter of intent to lease a new 86k square-foot facility in Da Nang, Vietnam.
    • The company expects new manufacturing facilty to be operational by July 2019.
    • Craig Gates, President & CEO: “By further diversifying our global manufacturing, we also believe it provides an additional hedge against uncertainty in a lingering or future trade war with China.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM

  • Crude also gives back some gains

    • The major averages are giving back a bit less than half of yesterday's surge, with the Nasdaq currently lower by 2% and the S&P 500 by 1.45%.
    • Alongside, WTI crude oil is down 2.8% to $44.94 per barrel following yesterday's near-10% moonshot. USO -3.8%
    • The Energy SPDR (XLE -2%)
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, UGA, DTO, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, WTIU, OILK, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 27 Comments
  • WATT

    Energous leads consumer gainers; Tesla and JAKKS Pacific among losers

    • Gainers: Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) +70%. Tuniu (NASDAQ:TOUR) +9%. Xcel Brands (NASDAQ:XELB) +9%. China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS) +7%. Reed's (NYSEMKT:REED) +6%.
    • Losers: Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) -10%. Libbey (NYSEMKT:LBY) -6%. Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) -6%. Acme United (NYSEMKT:ACU) -6%. JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 19 Comments
  • OZM

    Och-Ziff Capital now sees switch to corporation in April

    • Och-Ziff Capital Management (OZM -4.6%) now sees its tax classification changing to a corporation effective April 1, 2019, instead of the original expected date of Dec. 31, 2018.
    • Expects final partnership distribution for Q4 2018 on March 29, 2019 to shareholders of record at the close of business on March 22, 2019.
    • Previously: Och-Ziff jumps 13% after chairman transition, debt reduction plans (Dec. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 13 Comments
  • BTAI

    Avadel Pharmaceuticals and Novus Therapeutics among healthcare gainers; Spectrum Pharmaceuticals leads the losers

    • Gainers: BioXcel Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BTAI) +55%. Novus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NVUS) +14%. Avadel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVDL) +14%. Cue Biopharma (NASDAQ:CUE) +11%. Checkpoint Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CKPT) +11%.
    • Losers: Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SPPI) -13%. Nightstar Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NITE) -12%. Evelo Biosciences (NASDAQ:EVLO) -11%. Aquestive Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AQST) -10%. Kiniksa Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KNSA) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • NETE

    Net Element +6.6% on cash flow asset purchase

    • Net Element (NASDAQ:NETE) acquires certain recurring cash flow assets from Argus Merchant Services and Treasury Payments for $1.42M.
    • The assets are expected to generate over $4M in gross profits over the next four years. Argus' total billing commitment to Net Element is expected to add over $19M in gross margin over five years.
    • Net Element shares are up 6.6% to $6.42.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM

  • Stocks recede from Wednesday's surge

    • The delayed Santa rally didn't last long. Stocks pull back from Wednesday's rally with the basic materials sector (-1.8%) down the most as oil also sinks.
    • S&P -1.4%, Nasdaq -1.2%, and the Dow -1.5% (off 346 points) in early trading.
    • Other sectors leading the decline include conglomerates (-1.5%), consumer goods (-1.5%), and consumer services (-1.5%).
    • The best performers are tech (-1.1%) and utilities (-1.2%).
    • U.S. crude oil -1.9% to $45.36/bbl.
    • Gold gains 0.4% to $1,278.10 per oz.
    • U.S. dollar index weakens 0.3% to 96.74.
    • 10-year Treasury rallies, lowering yield by 5 basis points to 2.76%.
    • Previously: Futures pull back after post-Christmas surge (Dec. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 31 Comments
  • GSM

    Ferroglobe to close Niagara facility

    • Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) announces additional capacity reductions with intentions to suspend operations at the Niagara Falls, NY facility by December 30.
    • The facility has two submerged arc furnaces with production capacity of up to 27,000 tons of silicon metal annually and the stoppage will impact 100 employees.
    • Ferroglobe shares open down 0.6% to $1.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 25 Comments
  • LTS

    Ladenburg Thalmann buys back almost 51M shares from Frost

    • Ladenburg Thalmann Financial Services (NYSEMKT:LTS) sinks 3.5% after buying 50.9M shares of common stock from its principal shareholder and former chairman, Phillip Frost, for $2.50 apiece.
    • Frost is facing charges from the SEC related from alleged "pump-and-dump" stock promotion schemes.
    • LTS funded deal with $50.9M in cash and $76.4M of 7.25% senior notes due 2028.
    • Options to buy 3.61M shares of stock held by Frost were cancelled in exchange for $3m in cash.
    • Also, LTS's $40M revolving credit pact with Frost's Frost Gamma Investment Trust was terminated as of Dec. 24, 2018; at the time of termination, no outstanding amounts were owed by the company under the credit agreement.
    • Previously: Ladenburg Thalmann surges after Frost gives up chairman role (Sept. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • SESN

    Sesen Bio to host conference call on January 3 to review updated VISTA trial; shares up 7% premarket

    • Sesen Bio (NASDAQ:SESN) will host a conference call on Jan. 3, 2019 at 8:30 a.m. ET to review updated data from its Phase 3 VISTA Trial of Vicinium for the treatment of patients with high-grade non-muscle invasive bladder cancer who have been previously treated with bacillus Calmette-Guérin.
    • Shares are up 7% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 11 Comments
  • ICL

    ICL enters five-year pact to supply potash to India

    • ICL (NYSE:ICL) gets a five-year supply pact with Indian Potash Limited, India's largest importer of potash.
    • ICL expects to supply IPL with 600,000 tonnes per year in 2019 and 2020, increasing to 650,000 tonnes per year in 2021-2023, including options.
    • Prices to be determined according to prevailing market prices in India at the relevant date of supply.
    • ICL slips 0.7% in premarket trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • WATT

    WATT, COTY and SBGL among premarket gainers

    • Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) +29% on first FCC consumer product approval.
    • Sesen Bio (NASDAQ:SESN) +8%.
    • Coty (NYSE:COTY) +7%.
    • Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) +7%.
    • Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • CEI

    CEI and DNR among premarket losers

    • Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) -16%.
    • Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) -6%.
    • Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • CDE

    Coeur Mining reports Silvertip initial reserve estimate, mine plan

    • Coeur Mining (NYSE:CDE) reports Silvertip initial proven and probable reserves of 1.8M tons based on drilling results received through October.
    1. About 15.0M oz. of silver, 292.7M pounds of zinc, and 198.7M pounds of lead.
    2. 14% increase in companywide silver equiv. reserves and 13% increase in companywide silver equiv. reserve grade.
    • Coeur +1.5% in premarket trading.
    • Additional 1.3. tons of measured and indicated resources and 0.6M tons of inferred resources.
    • Initial mine life of 4.5 years based on proven and probable reserves; production rate of about 1,100 tpd and expected average annual production of about 8.2M silver equiv. oz, including 2.9M oz of silver, 45M pounds of zinc, and 37M pounds of lead.
    • Total capital costs of $44M to support continued acceleration of underground development activity and mill upgrades.
    • Initial pretax cash flow of $164M.
    • Initial pretax NAV of $147M.
    • Previously: Coeur declares commercial production at Silvertip, updates production view (Sept. 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 16 Comments
  • ESV

    Ensco -3.5% on Piper's Rowan deal doubt

    • Ensco (NYSE:ESV) slides after a Piper note suggests Rowan (NYSE:RDC) shareholders might be less likely to approve the deal after the recent selloff.
    • Source: Briefing.com.
    • The two offshore drillers previously announced a planned all-stock merger that would give ESV and RDC shareholders 60.5% and 39.5% stakes, respectively, in the combined company.
    • ESV shares are down 3.5% premarket, 40% in the month, and 56% in the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 34 Comments
  • ASH

    Ashland -1.5% after updating outlook for composites, BDO sale

    • Ashland Global Holdings (NYSE:ASH) slips 1.5% in premarket trading after updating fiscal 2019 adjusted EPS to $3.10-$3.40 from prior view of $4.20-$4.40.
    • New guidances reflects the pending divestiture of its composites business and BDO manufacturing facility in Marl, Germany, with transaction closing date at the end of June 2019 quarter.
    • Q1 adjusted EPS guidance to 5 cent-15 cents from its prior view of 55 cents-65 cents.
    • Full benefit of restructuring and interest expense savings from planned debt reduction will be realized during fiscal 2020.
    • Reaffirms business outlook for each operating segments as provided in its fiscal Q4 2018 earnings release.
    • Previously: Ashland to sell Composites business, German butanediol plant for $1.1B (Nov. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • BTAI

    BioXcel +15% on Fast Track designation

    • BioXcel's (NASDAQ:BTAI) investigational drug BXCL501 - a proprietary sublingual film of dexmedetomidine, for the treatment of acute agitation - has been granted Fast Track Designation by the FDA.
    • Top-line data from the Phase 1 study of the drug is expected in H1 2019.
    • Shares +15.35% premarket
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • NVDA

    RBC cuts Nvidia target, warns on ASPs

    • RBC maintains an Outperform rating on Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) but lowers the target from $230 to $200.
    • Analyst Mitch Steves: "The secondary market for GPUs appears to be reducing the average selling price which we think could impact the 4th quarter."
    • The gaming-related revenue reset will make it difficult for Nvidia or AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) to rise until after Q1.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Nvidia shares are down 1.6% premarket to $131.
    • AMD shares are down 1.9% to $17.56.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM | 61 Comments
  • CBS

    Loop Capital: CBS at 'attractive level'

    • CBS (NYSE:CBS) +1.3% premarket after Loop Capital reiterated a Buy recommendation on shares, stating the company has the most favorable risk/reward profile of the media companies it covers.
    • The firm also said uncertainty regarding a new CEO, the network’s NFL contract, and a potential Viacom merger has driven the stock's price down to an "extraordinarily attractive level."
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • JD

    JD plans Mall restructuring

    • JD.com (NASDAQ:JD) will restructure its JD Mall business into three departments, according to a document viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
    • JD Mall, the top revenue generator, will split into platforms for customers, business support services, and infrastructure control and risk management.
    • The revamp was revealed internally last Friday, shortly before Minnesota authorities declined to charge JD CEO Liu Qiangdong with sexual assault. The months-long controversy surrounding the exec's arrest pressured JD shares and raised questions about Qiangdong's tight grip, which includes 80% voting rights and the board's inability to meet without him.
    • A JD spokeswoman tells WSJ the restructuring will help "achieve quality growth" while better meeting customer needs.
    • JD shares are down 3.1% premarket to $20.45. Shares are down 49% YTD.
    • Previously: JD announces $1B share repurchase program (Dec. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 15 Comments
  • WATT

    Energous +25% on first FCC consumer product approval

    • Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) gains 25% premarket after announcing its first FCC approval for a commercial product, the WattUp-enabled personal sound amplification products from Delight.
    • The PSAPs help with hearing loss but tend to cost less than traditional hearing aids. Energous' WattUp wireless tech allows the Delight PSAP to charge on a charging pad.
    • The products, in partnership with SK Telesys, are now certified to be marketed and sold in the United States.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 86 Comments
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific buys remaining Millipede shares

    • Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) has exercised its option to buy the remaining shares of Millipede after its successful first-in-human clinical study.
    • Under the original purchase agreement in January, Boston Scientific paid $90M with the option to acquire the remaining shares at $325M at closing with a $125M payment becoming available by meeting a commercial milestone.
    • BSX expects the deal to close in 1Q19. The deal is expected to cut adjusted EPS for several years but the dilutive impact will be absorbed by internal trade-offs.
    • Boston Scientific shares are down 1.7% to $33.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • SNP

    Sinopec slips after shakeup at trading arm

    • Chinese state oil major Sinopec (NYSE:SNP), Asia's largest refiner, has suspended two top officials at its trading arm due to "severe trading losses."
    • Senior executives, Ling Yi Qun and Chen Gang, will manage Unipec in their place.
    • Oil prices have fallen more than 30% since hitting their highest in four years in October, while a sudden widening of the WTI-Brent crude spread has also led to hefty losses at major traders.
    • SNP -3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 AM
